page.title: 11RELIGION IN THIS AREA
page.content: The ecclesiastical Parish of Etherley is in the Deanery of Auckland and in the Diocese of Durham. The Parish was formed in 1832 in response to a petition made by 11 men to the then Bishop of Durham, William Van Mildert. He was the last Prince Bishop of Durham and he built the Parish Church in 1832, the same year that he founded the University of Durham. The Parish Church, dedicated to St. Cuthbert, stands in its own church yard which was originally called Railey Fell. Until 1832 Etherley, Toft Hill, Windmill and Morley were part of the old parish of St. Helen's, Auckland. The Parish covers an area of about 10 square miles and in 1984 the population was reckoned to be 1670 people.
